summary: This is an email chain from August 14, 2019, discussing urgent staffing and overtime questions at MCC New York and MDC Brooklyn, specifically for the period of August 4-10, 2019. The context suggests internal Bureau of Prisons communication under pressure, likely related to the aftermath of Jeffrey Epstein's death in custody on August 10, 2019.

events.title: Epstein Death in Custody
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York. The email's focus on staffing and overtime for the week leading up to and including this date suggests an internal review of prison operations surrounding the incident.

events.title: Start of Critical Staffing Review Period
events.description: The beginning of the one-week period (August 4-10, 2019) for which detailed staffing augmentation and overtime data is being urgently requested from MCC New York.

locations: MCC New York (Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York)
keyFacts: The email is dated August 14, 2019, four days after Jeffrey Epstein's death in custody on August 10, 2019.
It contains an urgent request for detailed staffing data (augmentations, mandated overtime, volunteer overtime) from MCC New York for the period August 4-10, 2019, the week Epstein died.
The sender mentions 'getting the heat here' and a need to inform the 'Acting Director' before noon, indicating high-level pressure and scrutiny following Epstein's death.
The request includes obtaining copies of overtime sign-up documents, suggesting an internal audit of prison procedures.
The email references 'AWOL figures,' which may imply concerns about staff absenteeism or unaccounted personnel during the critical period.
